p: The same is true for developing countries. As an example, the observation was made in South Africa that children vaccinated with the 7-valent conjugate pneumococcal vaccine showed 31% reduction in virus-associated pneumonias requiring hospitalisation, strongly emphasising the presumed importance of dual infections involving S. pneumonia [ 13]. Dual infection seems to increase the severity of the disease and to result in higher mortality. This might be due to inhibition of pulmonary antibacterial defenses during recovery from viral infectiions.
